page.title: 17MEMORIES OF NATLAND.
page.content: { }Mr. Charnley is a long-standing resident of{Natland.}Like his grandmother before him, he was married in the village. His great-grandfather is buried in the churchyard. Children from{St. Mark's}interviewed} him on his memories of Natland. The green, he feels, is what has changed most; when he first arrived in 1940 it was played on much more than today. The older{houses}he says have changed very little, but having witnessed the arrival of the newer houses and estates, he maintains they spoil Natland as a village. Although he concedes that it is a much tidier place now than it was forty-five years ago, Mr. Charnley prefers the 'old' Natland. He enjoys all the children who live in the village because they keep him entertained!
